Startup tip:

When a potential customer, client, vendor, or investor doesn't reply, email them again.

A week later, again.

A week after that, again.

You'd be surprised how many people aren't ignoring you. They're just swamped. Your following up isn't annoying.

It's helpful.

Call up founders of early stage startups you admire.

Get them to to talk to you about what they do. Ask them questions. Ask them if you can invest $2000

Chat with other investors. If accredited, ask if you can join their @AngelList syndicate. Tip: many founders also invest. 😇

Pro Tips: 
1. For every startup you didn't invest in, write clear notes on the reasons why you passed

2. Visiting founders and their office is a good idea. You can really get the sense of a company if you go to their office. Are they wasting money on expensive chairs and tables?
#Startup tip:  Most of the early assumptions we have about starting a business are wrong. Try and crush your idea as quickly as you can. If it still holds up, you may have something worth your time.
Quick SEO tip. List your startup on Crunchbase. Don’t say I didn’t do anything for you 😅

#Startup Tip: Your customers are trying to accomplish something. If what they are using now isn’t getting the job done, you have an opening. Will your product/service make it easier, faster, better, or cheaper to reach their goals?
Tip of the day: If you do not fire the bad employees the good employees will leave. #startups #business

#Startup Tip:  If starting a business is part of your 2022 plans, ask yourself what you’re trying to bring into your personal life. Being a business owner will run you into the ground if you don’t know what you’re trying to achieve and why.
